title: Add Turkish site language with dropdown and Turkish PDF for newsletters

requirements.text: Restrict the language picker UI to a dropdown that shows English as the default/primary selection and offers exactly two options: English and Turkish.

quotes: create a Turkish version of the website, add a language button dropdown menu under English

acceptanceCriteria: The header language button displays the currently selected language name.
The dropdown contains exactly: English, Türkçe.
Selecting Turkish updates the app language state to Turkish; selecting English switches back to English.

requirements.text: Implement Turkish translations for all user-facing text currently hardcoded in the UI (e.g., header title, newsletter titles/descriptions/status labels/buttons, PDF viewer controls) so that switching the language to Turkish renders Turkish text throughout the site.

quotes: Add the Turkish translations for all text in the Turkish version of the site.

acceptanceCriteria: When Turkish is selected, all visible UI strings are Turkish (no leftover English UI labels such as “View Newsletter”, “Published”, “Upcoming”, “Coming Soon”, “Download”, “Page X of Y”, header title, and placeholder newsletter text).
When English is selected, the UI remains in English.
Translations are sourced consistently (single system of record) and do not require editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths.

requirements.text: Add support for language-specific PDF selection so that when Turkish is selected, the newsletter PDF opened in the viewer uses the attached Turkish PDF; when English is selected, it uses the existing English PDF.

quotes: Swap the English PDF for the attached Turkish PDF when the user selects Turkish.

acceptanceCriteria: With English selected, opening Newsletter 1 loads the current English PDF asset.
With Turkish selected, opening Newsletter 1 loads the Turkish PDF provided by the user (the attached file) instead of the English PDF.
Switching language changes which PDF is opened without requiring a page refresh.

requirements.text: Ensure the application UI and generated outputs do not add any assistant/AI credits or “built by” attribution text anywhere in the site (including footer and any modal/about areas).
acceptanceCriteria: No UI element contains assistant/AI credit text (e.g., “Built by…”, “Powered by…”, assistant name/branding).
Existing non-AI copyright text remains unchanged unless required for translation.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (including frontend/src/components/ui, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts/tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.
nonGoals: Add or enable additional languages beyond English and Turkish.
Add third-party translation services or external APIs.
Redesign the PDF viewer behavior beyond selecting the correct PDF per language.
